title: Fun hoop, but does sag
text: This hoop is about what you would expect. It has a large basket, which is nice. The adjustable height is easy to operate and is a great feature for a growing kid. I would absolutely recommend this version with 3 balls. The only negative I've found so far is that, similar to other reviewers, the rim does sag down. It appears to be due to a combination of where the backboard connects to the pole and then where the rim connects to the backboard. It is all just plastic snapped together, so the combo of these two imperfect connections means that the rim does have a slight downward sag. It's a kid toy, though, so it ends up not being a huge deal. It seems like something the manufacturer could correct with a slight design change. Overall though, I would recommend the hoop.

title: Excellent Choice for Three Boys!
text: A great little basketball set, especially the option including three basketballs. As a Christmas gift for my 20 month old grandson, this selection was a real hit! His two older brothers (ages 9 and 4) were happy to play, too and everyone had their own basketball. This was a real incentive for the little one, as he has much more fun when the others are involved. The stand, base and net are very sturdy and assembly was simple. It's so nice when a toy seems to be one which will be enjoyed over time and I think this one will be. Even 'Dad' couldn't resist trying to make a few baskets!

I plan on figuring out a fix myself, but it seems like this could easily be fixed with just a little tweak to the rim design. Overall, a great product for kids to play with (my 2.5 year old daughter loves it!), just wish I didn't spend so much time fixing the net from falling off.

title: Pretty Good but Could Use Some Simple Improvements
text:
I bought this for my 17 month old son who is deep in the toddler habit of throwing everything he can get his hands on. I wanted to channel his desire in a fun way, while developing hand eye coordination, and not just telling him no or taking his toys away. This hoop has met most of my expectations so far:

Pro's:

Easy setup
Adjustable Height
Big, Forgiving Rim
Soft, Grippy BasketBalls
Hoop is Quite Sturdy After Filling With Sand
My Son Loves It!!

Con's:
Sand Filling Hole is Tiny and the Base is Leaking a Tiny Bit of Sand.
Rim is Somewhat Flimsy so I Could See it Breaking if Pulled Down on With too Much Force.
No Wheels, so Once You've Added 50lbs of Sand it's Not Easy to Move.

All in all, this hoop could use some simple improvements, but I'm still really happy with it. Especially under 40 bucks with three balls. Add five bucks for sand and you'll be set.

text: This is such a great product for our very energetic 2 year old. The adjustable height is great; I foresee it being useful for quite a while. The bottom has the option of being filled with sand or water, but right now it's just in our hallway without anything to weigh it down, and it's perfect. The balls are much smaller than normal basketballs, and are bouncy, which is good, because when the ball rebounds into my child's face, it bounces off and he smiles as if nothing happened. Everything is made of plastic, but it all seems very durable, as long as you aren't trying to bend it or swing off the rim.

title: Packaging does not make for a good gift & is not cute
text: Bought as a birthday gift for a baby who's father loves basketball, so I'm sure it will be loved by both father and son. This review is for the packaging since I can't rate the actual product since it's not being used for my own kid, but just wanted to give a warning about the packaging if you are buying this as a gift. Packaging is "earth friendly" but not "gift giving friendly". It is "go green" packaging in a large cardboard box with the name of what it is written in small letters, but no photo, explaination or instructions of what is inside. Packaging is large and heavy. Hopefully assembly instructions are included in the box. I'm sure it's pretty easy to assemble without instructions and I'm sure something is included, but it would be nice to have it all right there on the box when they open it, since it is a gift. Just makes it harder for them to see what they are being given. I can respect trying to make the earth a nicer place, but I'm sure they could have figured something better out for the box with some kind of nice photo and title.

title: Good Basketball Set!
text:
So far this basketball set is working out very well. Our child has been using it since he was 13 months, and has been getting the hang of it. At the lowest setting, he is able to dunk the ball, and the hoop has many higher settings, so we expect to get several years' use out of this. It came with 3 basketballs and was fairly easy to assemble (with the exception of stringing on the net, which was tedious).

The base can be filled with water and is pretty good at preventing the basket from tipping over. Our son has tried to pull the hoop down a few times, but each time the base lifts it back up to upright (without any water spills so far too).

Overall, we are happy with this set so far and would recommend it.

title: Rim can be better
text: At the lowest height, this is still a little high for my 14 months old nephew.  He is still able to put the balls through though.  The lowest setting is 2ft but that's not counting the base.  The base add a couple more inches high.  Assembly was easy.  The rim is a bit flimsy and a bit bent.  It does tilt forward a bit.  The net gets unhooked sometimes (not fully apart though) and I have to hook it back on.  The knob where you either put water or sand into the base, was a bit difficult to remove.  I haven't put water or sand into it yet so I cannot comment about that but I would say it's necessary!  Especially for a grabby toddler.  It will easily tip over.  Mine came with three balls and they're good size.  They're firm but at the same time squishy.  Since the hoop is a bit high at the moment, my nephew has been using the balls for soccer.

title: PROVEN LITTLE TIKES BBALL SET
text: I would imagine they sold millions of these, because I see it pretty much in every friend's house who has a young boy(s) at home.  There are lots of similar products, and even Little Tikes came up with a one that extends higher in height, but this is perfect for my 16 month old son (currently I have it set on the lowest height and my son walk-dunks on it regularly.  Walmart also had it for cheaper at the time of my search ($29 compared to $34 here at Amazon) but the picture showed only one ball, so I went with this one.  Having three balls is definitely a plus if you don't like to be fetching for your son non-stop.  Some reviewers said the rim falls out over time (and I can see it happening perhaps if you use it a lot), but for us it has held up with no problem after using it for few months (my guess is it might not have clicked all the way during the time of assembly, because they do tell you on the manual to actually step on the rim with the backboard lying flat on the floor to snap it into place).  I have it placed in our living room with the base filled water and my son is not able to tip it over yet so it's quite sturdy and durable so far.  And another thing, I don't know if the designers intended it when they made it, but the front of the base has this slant to it so when the ball drops it nicely rolls back to you if you shoot it straight into the hoop.  Overall, my son loves playing with it from time to time and that makes two of us.

text: My grandson wanted this Little Tikes EasyScore Basketball set. He went to his cousin‚Äôs house and they had one for the youngest  cousin. Joe, 14 and his other cousin, 13 played with it and had a ball. Joe loves basketball and is on his 9th grade team. Anyway, I ordered one for him at his house. He loves it, just doing shots. I ended up ordering one for my house too. I had my two other grandsons, (10 &8), for a few overnights last week and they had a ball playing with it in my entryway. It‚Äôs all plastic so nothing get damaged . I just move the little entryway table into a different area, put the basketball stand in front of my entryway door and they go at it. It‚Äôs winter and cold here in Michigan, and this is just great even for a boy who will be 15 next month. My only issue is, I‚Äôm not sure I put the net on properly, there were no directions. I did enlarge and look at the picture on Amazon to see how they have it and I think I did the exact same thing. Also, we couldn‚Äôt get the rim to stay in, but I think the issue was we really hadn‚Äôt push it in until we heard it snap. Finally did that with my husband‚Äôs help and now it stays in no problem. Love that my grandson have a ball with it here at Nonna‚Äôs House. üòäüëçüèªüá∫üá∏

title: Super fun and super easy!
text:
We purchased this product here because this was the least expensive (with shipping) of all the stores we researched. The hoop arrived very quickly and was gift wrapped for us. The hoop was VERY simple to set up. I had the whole thing ready to go (net too) in under five minutes. The pieces snapped together nicely and we were playing in no time. My son loves this and plays with it whenever he can find a ball, even if it isn't the ball that came with it. I would highly recommend this product because it was sturdy, simple to assemble, and fun!

We didn‚Äôt fill the bottom portion with sand so understandably it tips over sometimes. Assembly took a few minutes the longest part was getting the net set up. Bought another one for grandmas house!

title: Serious hand, eye, leg, feet coordination and an algebraic problems to always solve...like in pool
text: Algebraic style coordination, small and large muscle coordination and team vs team ... teaches competition early on I had all boys this stayed in use for a long time. They especially loved it when there were older/bigger and could walk by and drop one in...seems to have a great satisfaction for them! Also leads to the hoop on the garage, then the one at school playgrounds (I was always in attendance so some were later in the evening) It's like pool which is also algebraic style coordination, run..wobble PLAN the shots the banks the backboard...that all begins here. They get very good at BBall.  They were in the city water polo and swim teams, roller hockey, t-ball then little league, AYSO, homework..My husband had died when my youngest was in the womb so I worked but needed to finish off my schooling so we all did homework together. I totally unplugged NO CABLE nada the television. I would rent they could pick they had parameters and I saw WAY TO MANY Chinese martial art's movies but I wanted my boys (I had all boys) to develop an IMAGINATION, play pretend, make and keep friends build lopsided forts in my back yard (Merciful land lord) I wanted my boys to have what I had - to be a kid! No gaming at all not even Game Boys Lot's of arguments about that 'cuz billy up the street this and that...I must say they ALL did and are doing the same with their boys...I've not on daughter or granddaughter...HOW SAD!! Because between 13-14 boys turn into Guys and you totally don't see that coming the first time! Then they won't go to the mall with you yada yada yada...and shopping for them becomes a military black ops mission!  We will enter the mall at such and so we will park the car at so & so's store, we will walk in take the first left on the first floor. You will NEVER try to show me clothes you like etc etc etc... Honestly! Their friends all called me Moms etc...it isn't like ppl didn't know they were mine and I was 'OH HORRORS OH NOESSS' with them ... just to pay. Ah Yes Now it begins again@

title: Fun introduction to basketball and helps improve gross motor skills
text:
Assembly was pretty quick and easy. The instructions say to pour sand in the base to keep it upright. We decided not to do that and haven‚Äôt had any problems. A toddler can definitely pull it down on their own but as it is pretty light weight I doubt that it would ever cause much damage but if you have a small baby around that is something to think about.

I got it for my daughter‚Äôs first birthday and at first she needed a boost to put the ball in but she soon figured out how to lift the ball above her head and gained the balance necessary to do so and put the ball in. She started walking right around her birthday so it was perfect for helping her to learn to balance better. 4 months later we still love it and play with it often. Ours came with 3 balls.

Please mark if you found my review helpful. Thanks!

title: Great buy... every kid should have one!
text:
Great buy!! This hoop is a little more expensive than other stores, but comes with 3 balls instead of 1. The prices comes out to be better than buying the balls separate, so I highly recommend purchasing from Amazon. We have owned the Little Tikes Basketball hoop for 8 years, and it's held up well. We just bought another one since my youngest loves basketball and we wanted to keep one inside (outdoor one is full of water from rain). The only issue I have with the new one is the net keeps coming off when we shoot hoops in it. I'm assuming this will stop happening once the net gets worn in and doesn't spring loose, but I may try attaching it a different way to get it to stop.

I'd highly recommend purchasing this! It's even fun for the adults... who doesn't love shooting hoops?! :)

text: Our toddler was watching his big brothers shoot hoops and really wanted to participate. So we got him this-- it's perfect size for him-- and placed it right next to the "big boy" basketball hoop. Every now and then he gets frustrated because he is trying to fit the big (real) basketball through this basket, and it doesn't fit, which is a good lesson for him to learn how object sizes work. His big brothers also like playing with this toy (with or without the toddler), so that's a plus too.

title: My 4 toddler boys love it.
text:
This goal was easy to assemble without need of tools. Imagine my surprise when my 22 month old hit an arching shot from 6 feet away on his very first try. I tell you that made my Christmas. I'm a proud dada for sure. I didn't even have to show the boys what to do with this toy, they instinctively knew.

Pros: Packaged without frustrating nonsense.
Assembles in a minute without tools.
Stands upright without weighting the base but has the option to do so if you want to add sand for extra support.
Adjustable to grow with your kids.
Classic style with no tacky graphics or characters.
3 basketballs come inflated and ready to play and can be stored on the rim if you place them all in at the same time.

Cons: None so far.

It doesn't mean that it was a returned product. Assembly is quick, and the one thing which was a topic in earlier reviews is the attachment of the basket to the backboard assembly. It does require considerable force, and you need to be sure that it is fully inserted and clicks into place, but once correctly assembled it is very sturdy. It has already provided lots of entertainment for us.

title: ... 2 year old boy and 4 year old girl love this basketball hoop
text: Our 2 year old boy and 4 year old girl love this basketball hoop. We got it a little over a month ago and store it in our garage and get it out when we go outside. It‚Äôs so great that it comes wth 3 balls so multiple kids can play at a time and not have to wait for a ball. The different heights are great, the lowest setting works very well for our 2 yo but he likes it to be a challenge so we have it on the highest setting. I only gave 4 stars because we purchased a bag of sand to put in the base to keep it from tipping over easily but it was kind of difficult to get sand in through the hole so eventually we gave up and filled it with water. Also the way the net is attached to the hoop could be a little better, the net keeps slipping back out of the holes (see picture). Overall my husband and I are very pleased with this basketball hoop and so are our kids. It was a great price, and seems like it will last for years.

He loves making baskets, and he's really good at it too! It has three height settings and we have it on the middle setting. We didn't put sand in the base and we think it's plenty stable without it. This also makes it easy to move if we want. We must admit, grandma and grandpa like to shoot too. This is a good quality and fun hoop!

title: It does tip over easily inside the house as it's on carpet
text: We bought this for our 2 year old grandson for his birthday.  He loves it.  His birthday is in January and we live in New England, so, he plays with it inside for now.  The base is made to be able to put water inside of it to keep it secure.  It does tip over easily inside the house as it's on carpet, but, I'm assuming that that will change when we can put it outside in the spring, and put water in the base.  The balls are made well and aren't too hard or soft.  I don't worry that they will break anything.  I will come back to this review in the spring/summer when we get it outside!

title: Every child needs this...boys AND girls
text:
Well made (for being plastic), sturdy even without sand in the base (although it will need the sand when my grandson gets older). Two-year old likes this, although it doesn't keep him busy for hours...I expect it will, though. The selling point on this is the ability to adjust the height, making it a real bargain. How many toys that keep a child ACTIVE can you use over four years? This develops hand and eye coordination and provides lots of movement as children chase the balls. Highly recommended, especially since I find myself (an old grandma) enjoying sitting in a chair and tossing a few hoops, too!

Update 1/29/17: A flaw in the design of this is the basket is easily loosened, even by itself. We awoke one night, grabbed the shotgun, and stealthily tiptoed down the steps to discover that the thump we heard in the den was the basket falling off the stand! While it was a relief, then, it is not fun when my grandson throws a ball that hits the rim a few times, then KERPLUNK goes the basket. There is no need for the basket to be this loose as it has no part in the adjustability of the toy for the child as he or she grows. This needs to be redesigned. Grandpa is going to fix this problem with a permanent solution, but obviously the set will never be able to be packed in a box after that.

As they grow, the hoop can be adjusted higher.  I purchased it because my 10 month old was throwing her toy balls into the fireplace.  We taught her to shoot them into the hoop and problem solved.  My product only came with one ball, not three as advertised.

title: Best toy purchase we've ever made for our toddler
text: Bought this during March Madness - our toddler was really into the basketball games on TV and has a blast shooting hoops and dunking with the family in the living room. Adjustability is nice, the rim is durable even for when he holds on during dunks (he can't be bothered with a technical foul), and it comes with three really good balls. They bounce well enough even on tall shag carpeting, and don't seem to hurt when he rebounds with his face. Filling it with sand was a little tedious - but I don't want to deter you. Buy this and a bag of sand from the big box home improvement store for <$6 and you've got your name in the running for Parent of The Year Award.

title: Lightweight and easy to assemble (but without instructions)
text:
Rim installation: Like others have mentioned, you have to snap the pieces in hard. For the rim, I found it helpful to lay the baseboard flat and then push the rim in, reaching around the back to help it snap in. If done properly, you will see no gap between the rim and the baseboard.

Netting installation: To attach the net to the rim, you insert each loop through the middle hole from the bottom, then loop the string around the slots immediately next to the hole and pull to make it taut.

title: Loved Basketball hoop
text: [[VIDEOID:e671cfdd6777cd139ece45decc1080f8]] We love this basketball hoop and is used every day in our home. My toddler son loves it and even requests to have the height adjusted on a regular basis. It comes with three basketballs which are smaller in size but we have a variety of balls that work in this hoop. The bigger balls just have to be pushed down and they go through too just not as easily. **** Highly recommend getting 40 lb of sand at the hardware store before setting this up. We have used water and I think it is not enough/stable as it could be. It will be a challenge to put it out of commission briefly to dry out the base so we can add sand. Install is easy with two people took 10 min or less. This is a beloved toy in our home!

As a pediatric Occupational Therapist I was sure that the "just right challenge" inherent in this game would give him the pleasure that would motivate him to take more and more steps and I was right. He is now walking and Slamdunking non-stop.  We use this toy in our clinics and for good reason!  Hooray!!!

title: Game On!
text:
We have bought two of these Little Tikes Easy Score Basketball Sets. The first time was for our then four and six-year-old kids. We set it up inside for rainy-day fun. The second time was for my 85-year-old mom to liven up her physical therapy sessions. Her ball boy is my now 13-year-old, former Little Tikes-playing son.

I love repurposing products in ways beyond what the manufacturer intended. This hoop has brought a lot of fun into my mom‚Äôs workout, and allows her grandson to participate in her exercise program. Don‚Äôt let the ‚Äútikes‚Äù name fool you; this can be a challenging upper body workout for your senior. It tasks four key areas: balance, flexibility, strength, and endurance. We set the hoop on the two and three-foot heights for chair throws. She shoots, my son rebounds, and my mom has to track and catch the ball. We save the four-foot height for standing shots ‚Äì this works the balance portion of her therapy.

She does this for 20-minutes every day. All that arm motion, as well as the effort required to position and launch the ball, and maintain her posture, is a thorough workout for her. Plus, it‚Äôs engaging ‚Äì both physically and generationally: they can do serious work together in a silly way. Its lightweight design poses no tipping hazard, and is easy for both my parents to set up and store. This hoop is one of several products we‚Äôve bought to strengthen my mom‚Äôs manual dexterity and fine-motor skills. We also have the [[ASIN:B01FADOJ8K Giant Kerplunk]] (highly recommend for all ages), and the [[ASIN:B06XBZH1DZ RockJam electronic piano keyboard]].

Keep your elders in the game with this Little Tikes hoop set.

title: Check prices for 40 lb. Of sand you'll need.
text:
Says it all, right? Enough sand to fill this would cost $70 (Mar 2023). I'd thought I'd just fill it with some of the big rocks littering the edge of the yard... but unfortunately, the normally excellent engineers at Little Tikes designed this with a hole just over ONE INCH for the sand.
You'll want a funnel to go with that sand.

Otherwise, outstanding little product, so I gave 4 stars. Grandson is 2, he's gonna love it. Will wait a year or 2 before putting the net on.

title: Little Tikes has gone downhill
text: [[VIDEOID:2e6d96abe8189a8b52f95a835585f8bc]] I bought this for my grandson for his 2nd birthday because my boys loved it & it held up well over the years. Sad to say the quality of Little Tikes products has gone down the drain. The basketball hoop is flimsy at best. We have weighted the base down with pebbles but it is still looking like the Leaning Tower of Pizza. To get the hoop to stay in the base took a lot of force before it locked in.  Had I not just recently bought another Little Tikes product I probably would‚Äôve thought it was just this particular item. However we bought a Little Tikes Cozy Coupe car recently,  it was a nightmare to put together, and we had the hardest time keeping the floorboards secured. Back in the day the instructions and  assembly were very simplistic.  In fact, if I recall they came fully assembled. I thought we were in the day and age of making things simplistic and more time efficient !  Not sure if other manufacturers make a similar product that I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this one.

title: My 2 1/2 year old niece loves it!
text:
I bought this for my 2 1/2 year old niece and she has been in love with it. This comes with 3 balls which is perfect for easily distracted toddlers, just keep juggling them in! The adjustable height should be great as she continues her growth spurts.
We assembled this as a family and didn't have any real issues outside confusion with the net. Don't miss that the black tape on the net indicates it's the BOTTOM of the net, not the top!
The only other issue we had was with the weight. The base is entirely hollow plastic, so if you don't have sand or a lot of water on hand it will not yet be usable on its own.
It's nice to have this on hand so that my niece can keep getting exercise indoors when it's raining, whether in the house or the garage.

title: Not Any Good
text: I am completely dissatisfied. This product is not as well made as you would think. I put it together on Christmas day But where the rim "plugs" into the backboard, the pins did not stay latched into the dogs to hold it in, so that the rim is always pulling out. The picture even shows the child hitting the rim as he is shooting, that cant happen or it will pull the rim out. Thirty years ago I bought Little Tikes toys for my kids and they lasted, almost indestructible. I bought this for my granddaughter the quality is not there anymore. I cant return it because my dog bit a hole in one of the balls. I thought this item would last for many years is destined for the garbage dump in a few months.What a waste.

I would definitely recommend doing this to keep your kids from knocking it over and climbing on it like our heathens. title: Curse this infernal pile of junk
text: An average sized toddler can throw the ball through the hoop three, maybe four times before it comes clattering to the floor. There is no way I've found to jam the hoop into the backboard so it stays in for longer than that. This is the perfect gift for your kid if you have no job and no domestic responsibilities other than following a three-year-old around and fixing their toys every five minutes. If, on the other hand, you have to do things like--oh, I don't know- make breakfast for an entire family every morning before going to work, for example--this thing will drive you slowly insane. I don't wish harm or despair on anyone, but I hope the person who designed this thing has a bad day.

The height adjustment could be tough for a grandparent with arthritic fingers but could easily be managed with a makeshift tool. For everyone else super easy.

title: Great product for growing age
text: Assembly was a breeze. Very good quality product. You can adjust the height for growing age. Make sure you add some weight to the base (soil or water) to hold the structure from tripping over if hoop rim gets pulled.

title: So Easy To Assemble!
text: My children love this not just my toddlers but my 7 year old as well! Came packaged in a clean dent free box, inside it‚Äôs in 5 pieces; the base that can be filled with sand for stability, the trunk which adds the height, the backboard piece, the hoop, and the net. It was extremely easy to assemble without the instructions no screws, nuts, or bolts to struggle with. It‚Äôs so lightweight and easy to move both inside and outside of the garage so you can play with it even on rainy days. It comes with 3 pre inflated small basketballs (bonus) perfect for my toddlers hands. My 1.5 year old was able to use it and make baskets she does a little happy dance when she makes it in. :) so adorable seeing the look of glee written on their faces! The balls are soft enough that they don‚Äôt hurt when someone accidentally bonks themselves. The only complaint I have is it was really really hard to insert the hoop into the back board. But that just means it‚Äôs truly secure. Kind of a give and take in that aspect. So have someone assist you for that part if you can :) it may have just been an isolated incident. But it doesn‚Äôt change my 5 star review

title: Just as much fun for parents!
text:
Assembly was super simple. Snap 3 pieces together and hook the net loops on. The rim took a little extra force to snap into place, but once it's in there you will know. I have this set up in the living room for my 20 month old. I think my wife and I play with it as much as he does. Reminds me of the one I had almost 30 years ago. I plan to keep it indoors for now. I haven't filled the base with anything and it hasn't had to survive any serious dunks yet so I can't speak to the durability. I expect to get a few years of use out of it.

I specifically chose this kit because it came with 3 balls and has an adjustable height. Best value of the available options in my opinion. So far I'd recommend.

title: Best Toy We Have
text:
My two-year old is obsessed with basketball. Not sure why, but he saw some kids playing basketball at the park one day six months ago and ever since all he wants to do is play basketball.

His grandparents got him this hoop for his second birthday and it has been fantastic. I know this because I myself play a lot of basketball on it. I probably spend a minimum of four hours a week shooting hoops on this thing. As a grown adult, I can say it's actually a fun hoop to play with. The balls are sturdy and bouncy--not made of a cheap, hard plastic like some of the models we've seen. The hoop is sturdy and the whole thing can be moved indoors if it's hot or rainy outside.

The only problem we had was a minor one--parts of the net would sometimes slide off from the hoop attachments. It wasn't a big deal just a little annoying. I fixed this by tying a little thread underneath the parts of the net that would slide off (three or four little areas) and we haven't had an issue since.

title: Find sand that knows how to dump itself
text:
So, we received this as a gift for our son‚Äîerr, well, first we mistakenly received a sack of ball pit balls which really isn‚Äôt Little Tike‚Äôs fault but more on Amazon Fulfillment. Perhaps they shouldn‚Äôt run their warehouses like sweatshops and mistakes like these wouldn‚Äôt happen, anywho, that‚Äôs a review for a different time.

I‚Äôm giving this basketball hoop 1 star because it seems like a giant oversight on Little Tike‚Äôs part regarding filling up the base. Now, the instructions (pictured) recommend finding 40lbs worth of sand that can magically dump itself into the base utilizing a funnel that can circumvent the sand from piling up and backing the funnel up.

I don‚Äôt know if anyone was able to achieve these feats but I sure as heck couldn‚Äôt. So, 30 mins were spent constantly stopping and starting filling, getting sand everywhere, cursing to the heavens and praying my son will becomes a pro basketball player one day and makes dealing with this pain in the A process all worth it.
